poem:
Title: A Change of Leash

Alison, unwrapping a new dawn of Dogs,
Steps softly into Paul's fading echoes, 
Her heart – a kennel for gentle respect.
She knows the weight of the showman's hat, yet
Dares to enrobe in its solemn threads.

Behind the scenes, a legacy barks –
Chasing shadows of lost Paul, yet welcoming
Alison in the warm paws of continuity.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
